AtomicTypeÔÉÅ

class ase2sprkkr.sprkkr.atomic_types.AtomicType(symbol, atomic_number=None, n_core=None, n_valence=None, n_semicore=None, n_electrons=None, mesh=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Atomic type represent a type of atom, that could be placed at the atomic site.

It can be either a real chemical element, or vacuum pseudoelement. It also determine the number of electrons and valence electrons.

Class hierarchy


Constructor

__init__(symbol, atomic_number=None, n_core=None, n_valence=None, n_semicore=None, n_electrons=None, mesh=None)[source]ÔÉÅ
Parameters:

  • symbol (str or int) ‚Äì Chemical symbol, e.g. Fe, N, ‚Ä¶. If int is given, attempt to guess the symbol using third party library is done

  • atomic_number (int) ‚Äì Atomic number If it‚Äôs zero, an attempt to guess it from the chemical symbol is done.

  • n_core (int) ‚Äì Number of core electrons If it‚Äôs zero, an attempt to guess it from the chemical symbol/atomic number is done.

  • n_valence (int) ‚Äì Number of valence electrons If it‚Äôs zero, an attempt to guess it from the chemical symbol/atomic_number is done.

  • n_semicore (int) ‚Äì Number of semicore electrons If it‚Äôs zero, an attempt to guess it from the chemical symbol/atomic_number is done.

  • n_electrons (int)
